Built-in parameter profiles (param_configs)

Source: R/param_configs.R
param_configs.Rd

A named list of built-in parameter profiles used to configure run_model() and higher-level helpers. Each element is a list of baseline values; scenario-specific overrides (e.g., futureT, harvmgmt, factorMSY, maxsel, sdsel, and switches for agetrend, sizetrends, propFtrend) are applied at runtime.

Usage

param_configs

Format

A named list with two elements:

Ohlberger

Baseline profile for the Ohlberger-style setup.

Kuskokwim

Baseline profile for the Kuskokwim setup.

Each profile list can include (non-exhaustive):

  • Core switches: sim_recruits, est_method, ricker_type, var, optimize

  • Time horizon: nyi, nyh, ny (note: futureT is scenario-driven)

  • Errors: obserr, hobserr, harverr

  • Regimes: reglength, regstr

  • Stock–recruit: procerr, rho, alpha_mean, beta_mean, sr_corr, sr_parms_sd

  • Ages/structure: ages, meanageini, sdage

  • Trend baselines (multiplied by scenario switches): agetrend, sizetrends, propFtrend

  • Sex: propF, agediff

  • Growth/size: vonB_Linf, vonB_k, ocean0s, sdSaA

  • Allometry: allometry

  • Alternative SR params: alt_sr_param

Details

These profiles are intended to be layered over a generic default_config() and then modified with apply_scenario_overrides().

These are baselines only. For a full, ready-to-run config:

  1. Start with default_config(),

  2. Overlay one of param_configs[[...]],

  3. Call apply_scenario_overrides(cfg, scen_row), then

  4. Set cfg$j, cfg$k, and cfg$seednum.

See also

default_config(), apply_scenario_overrides(), run_scenarios(), run_model()

Examples

# Inspect available profiles
names(param_configs)
#> [1] "Ohlberger" "Kuskokwim"

# Build a config using the Ohlberger profile (pseudo-example):
# cfg <- utils::modifyList(default_config(), param_configs[["Ohlberger"]])
# cfg <- apply_scenario_overrides(cfg, scen_row)  # scen_row = one row from scenarios
# cfg$seednum <- 123; cfg$j <- 1L; cfg$k <- 1L
# run_model(cfg)

# Use directly in a higher-level runner (if it accepts `params =`):
# run_scenarios("all", niter = 10, params = param_configs[["Kuskokwim"]])
